Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring law enforcement officers to provide notice and obtain proof of consent to search individuals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring law enforcement officers to provide notice and obtain proof of consent to search individuals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting bias-based profiling.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring law enforcement officers to identify themselves to the public.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the investigating, reviewing, studying, and auditing of and making of recommendations relating to the operations, policies, programs and practices of the new york city police department by the commissioner of the department of investigation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Investigating, reviewing, studying, and auditing of and making of recommendations relating to the operations, policies, programs and practices of the NYPD by the commissioner of the department of investigation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the investigating, reviewing, studying, and auditing of and making of recommendations relating to the operations, policies, programs and practices of the new york city police department by the commissioner of the department of investigation.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Lander, Jackson, Williams, Rose, Mendez, James, Speaker Quinn, Reyna, Dromm, Mark-Viverito, Weprin, Lappin, Brewer, Gonzalez, Recchia, Comrie, Vann, Levin and Rodriguez.
